meanings.definition: To transfer or release one's interest in a property to another party.
meanings.sent1: She quitclaimed her share of the house to her sister.
meanings.sent2: He quitclaimed the land to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The cat quitclaimed its spot on the couch to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The sun quitclaimed its warmth to the approaching night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher quitclaimed the responsibility of leading the class to the student council president.

meanings.definition: The act of relinquishing one's claim or interest in a property.
meanings.sent1: The quitclaimed deed was signed and notarized.
meanings.sent2: He filed the quitclaimed document with the county office.
meanings.sent3: The quitclaimed certificate was framed and displayed proudly.
meanings.sent4: The quitclaimed letter was lost in the mail.
meanings.sent5: The quitclaimed agreement was binding and final.
